subject: RE: [junit] JUnit Reporting
msgSnippet: I knew this sounded familiar. Check out this thread.  The guy who posted this had a very similar question. http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/5872
messageBody:
I knew this sounded familiar.

Check out this thread. The guy who posted this had a very similar question.

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/5872

Good luck!

-----Original Message-----
From: Ranjeet Sahay [mailto:rsahay@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 08, 2003 10:49 AM
To: JUnit
Subject: [junit] JUnit Reporting


Hi,

Is there a way of creating report with JUnit which displays how many
tests passed
and how many failed(with possibly more details). The GUI is not
sufficient for reporting tests (which may be over 5000 running over
hours).

I have logs (using log4j) to look at but becomes awfull searching for
failures in maze of results. I have seen stuffs at IBM sites and also
can be made using
ant junitreport. But is there more easier way of making reports using
JUnit(add-on may be).

Desparately look for easier way for reporting.

Thanks.
